main_definition: A licence is a formal permission or authorization to do something, often granted by an authority.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Permission to drive a vehicle legally in the eyes of the law.
meanings_and_examples.example: After passing his driver's license test, John was now able to legally operate a car.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A document that grants someone the right to practice a profession or trade.
meanings_and_examples.example: The lawyer obtained her professional licence after successfully completing law school and passing the bar exam.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A permit allowing an individual or business to sell alcoholic beverages in public places.
meanings_and_examples.example: To sell alcohol, a restaurant owner needs to obtain a liquor licence from the local authorities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Authorization given by a governmental body to print money or mint coins.
meanings_and_examples.example: The central bank was granted a license to produce new currency notes for circulation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A license as part of an academic qualification, signifying that the holder has met certain standards and is therefore qualified in their field.
meanings_and_examples.example: With her doctoral degree, Sarah now holds a PhD licence to practice psychology.
